result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel W Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

May not hold public office.

Must provide DNA sample - No surcharge.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Kemp regarding jail credit

CASES:  11CF119, 12CF374 & 14CF309.  Defendant Gabriel W Wright in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Defendant Gabriel W Wright in custody.  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:36 a.m.  AO-Clerk.  Per de, correction to Page 3 of Revocation Order - Doesn't know of programming he was discharged from.  State - may be discrepancy on credit for time served.  MGoldsmith gives V/W statement.  Ct finds de qualifies for substance abuse treatment. 

SENTENCE:

11CF119 - 475 days credit.  
Count 1 - 8 years WSP 4 years I/C, 4 years E/S. Subj to qualification to CIP program & substance abuse treatment. Ct preserved parties on sentence credit issue. $2,757.56 due payable through DOC, if not paid by time probation ends, civil judgment.

12CF374 - 407 days credit.  Support in the amount of $19,789.53 payable through DOC, if not paid by time probation ends, civil judgment.
Count 1 - 36 months WSP, 18 mo I/C, 2 years E/S. To run concurrent w/ 11CF119.  
Count 5 - 1 year PCJ
Count 6 - 1 year PCJ

14CF309 1 year PCJ - subj. to GT & WR. 289 days credit.

All to run concurrent.

No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 

Case lists on sentence credit issue due from parites 11/10/2017.

PCR. 10:43 a.m. adj.
from SPD to Defendant re change in representation
Alexander Stormont

3 CASES:  11CF119, 12CF374 & 14CF309.  Defendant Gabriel W Wright in court, in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk.  9:55 a.m. Ct - Much off record discussion regarding attorney.  PD Coker called PD office.  PD will appoint new counsel.  JA to contact PD office and schedule sent. after rev. on all 3 files.  DE requests counsel be appointed other than Atty Petros.  30 pages Rev/Warrant packet given to DE.  9:57 adj.
from Defendant to Judge Anderson
from DOC to JLA re jail time

CASES:  12CF374 and 14CF309. Defendant Gabriel W Wright in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Defendant Gabriel W Wright in custody.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 2:30PM  Atty Tomtschik addresses issues about receiving 2 PSIs and recommendation.  DA Steffen and Atty Tomtschik do not have corrections to either PSI that have been submitted.  Atty Tomt. states that they are not withdrawing plea at this time.  M. Goldsmith (victim) speaks to the court.  Court - $18,847.17 in restitution (as of November 1) to be paid through probation and goes to Miranda Goldsmith.  If this is not paid off by end of Probation this will be converted to a civil judgment.  Break 3:48PM  Back on the record at 3:58PM  12CF374 being sentenced on counts 1, 5 and 6 - 14CF309 count 1 (the only count).  May not possess firearm.  Could lose right to possess body armor.  May not vote until civil rights are restored. May not hold public office.  Other civil rights may be lost.  Finds the defendant is eligible for CIP and SA.              

12CF374 - sentence w/held 3 years probation.  Run concurrent with 14CF309 and any other Probation that currently on.  Waives court costs on all felonies.  260 days of credit.  Conditional time of 9 months, Subject to WR and not subject to GT.  Complete all requirements set forth in Compas eval.  Must maintain employment once released from custody.  Be in conformance to requirements of Child Support.  

14CF309 - sentence w/held 3 years probation.  Run concurrent with 12CF374. Must provide DNA no surcharge.  6 mo banked time for probation use if necessary.  82 days of credit if revoked.  adj. 4:33PM

CASES: 12CF374 & 14CF309.  Defendant Gabriel W Wright in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Defendant Gabriel W Wright in custody.  Daniel Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:47 am.  
14CF309-Count 1-NC plea.  CT-adj guilty, judgment entered.  No firearms, cannot vote, no body armor, cannot hold elected office & other civil rights may be lost until restored.  PSI-short form-other PSI, COMPAS if not done w/ recommendation of both files.  Compas due 2 weeks before sentencing.  JA to set for sentencing w/ counsel. 11:00 am adj.
State's - Submitted by DA Steffen
Defendant's - submitted by Atty Tomtschik
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Information filed.  STom-NG plea, WST.  Bonds cont.  4:26 pm adj.

CASES: 14CF309 & 12CF374.  Defendant Gabriel W Wright in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 4:18 pm.  Waiver of PH.  CT finds PC, def bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 27, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
If bond posted and probation hold dropped defendant is to be held for further reasons of restitution.

Defendant Gabriel W Wright in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Defendant Gabriel W Wright in custody.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 1:48PM CASES: 14CF309 and 12CF374.  Attys requesting to not do sentencing on 12CF374 today.  Waives further reading.  Court - goes over CC/Penalities.  Bond continues.  Sentencing will be rescheduled.  12CF374 is to be set for status on same date and time. adj.  1:54PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
